job_title: Artist in San Francisco, CA
pros: Unique environment, great people, won't find anything else like this.
cons: Institutional instability, cost of living in San Francisco, difficulty of parking/commute.

job_title: Accounting Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Staffs were nice and interesting place to work
cons: Upper management was very bad

review_title: School closed in a blaze of mismanagement
job_title: Manager of Marketing in San Francisco, CA
pros: Beautiful location and history located in one of the best parts of town.
cons: Toxic environment that created silos which impacted the work experience.

job_title: Digital Designer in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great working with creative students
cons: low pay and bad upper management

review_title: great students, great staff, great faculty
job_title: Teaching Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: I loved working with the faculty. Good students and when the school was functioning there was a great student body
cons: not so great leadership. School was closed then it was open. The pandemic really hit this struggling art school hard. too many folks who when to school there and not enough outside voices

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: The environment is confortable, the space is beautiful and art is happening over there. Working at SFAI is belonging to an art history memory of the Bay Area and US in general. Now with the change of president the feel is better in the office, and there are lots of passionate people working to make SFAI go on.
cons: The people in the Administrative Offices were known in the school as particular. This seems to be the office more disconnected from the general artsy mood of the school, and feels more like a money-chasing environment. The school does need that office to get the money, but it can feel odd. The place also feels unstable given a lot of people have come and left lately. The whole feel of SFAI seems to be changing fast given they are accepting a lot of people in the school to get more money.

review_title: Amazing students, empassioned faculty + staff, but stuck in a rut
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Truly amazing student body with a strong passion for art-making and critical engagement, supported by even more amazing faculty artists and staff. Whenever I am on campus, I feel the energy of this creation + possibility, which is contagious. Plus, a historical building with stunning views.
cons: Staff attrition--SFAI has lost so many fantastic staff members because of a lack of agency to change methods in their department. Some administration stuck in their particular ways of working, not a structured advancement path for strong employees, small salary, old technology.

job_title: in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Beautiful campus
Friendly coworkers 
Great students
Constant new art and cool events
cons:
Crushing workload with no visible concern from management 
Low pay
Unstable staff (high turnover)
Poor technical infrastructure to facilitate quality work
No on boarding or training for many positions 
No long-term centralized information about operations systems

job_title: Administration in San Francisco, CA
pros: A real "team" working to serve terrific students, artists, and the Bay Area community. Smart, effective, lovely co-workers. Spectacular history, historic building, best views in the city. Plans for exciting new grad studios and gallery on a pier in SF Bay. Plans to hire new tenure faculty.
cons: Historic building has major drawbacks: often cold and damp; many windowless offices. Financial constraints of a dedicated, nonprofit art institute. Impacted full-time faculty.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: Meet new people and artists constantly. Beautiful views and neighborhood. Sense of community. Close to the piers and great food. 24/7 student access. Open to public for viewing during business hours and weekends. Unmetered street parking.
cons: The city has a tendency to be to cold for me, and it is also a very busy city for someone needing space. Minimal 2 hour limit street parking. A lot of good people work there but tends to turn over quickly, mostly because of outside career opportunities.

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: The best school I even went to and even work for. Great people, great cultural and great art!
cons: The only thing could be improved might be the parking there. I wish there could be more parking spots so I don't meet to move my car every two hours

job_title: Academic Tutor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Wonderful experience working in a tutoring center, great staff, supervisor/director cares about the students and is very understanding about changing schedules and adjusting work hours, good experience working in an academic/educational setting.
cons: It was a little difficult getting enough hours during the week since there were so many tutors on staff.

review_title: The best place for a student to work.
job_title: Tutor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Getting to know the department faculty was certainly a perk. Easy schedule changes, time to study while working, having the chance to grow a deeper knowledge of equipment through work.
cons: There is no chance for growth and minimal pay.

job_title: Peer Tutor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Positive group of students and teachers. Flexible schedule. Highest paid student job on campus.
cons: Some difficulty managing schedules and appointments.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Floyd, VA
pros: Good experience, the pay is OK for TAship
cons: None really. I was a student there. There is a problem of tuition and lack of scholorships.

job_title: Tutor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Excellent staff and leadership as well as flexibility
cons: Pay could be better taking into account the cost to live in the city

job_title: Tutor in San Francisco, CA
pros: Freedom of expression in campus
cons: Changing management and policy frequently.

job_title: Security in San Francisco, CA
pros: Using the basement storage area and hanging out there on break. Being allowed friends. Dating
cons: Dealing with kids and crusties

job_title: Student Worker in San Francisco, CA
pros:
- Nice people to work with 
- Laid back atmosphere 
- Art
cons:
- unstable management 
- dealing with teenagers

job_title: Visiting Faculty in San Francisco, CA
pros: the amazing view of the bay, great cafe'; engaging students; free parking
cons: antiquated chief financial officer; the politics, the ass-kissing Dean, dysfunctional senior management team;

job_title: Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Beautiful view of the city and great people that would like to make a diference.
cons: Horrible administration that is not utilizing the talented people at hand.
